thread.title: Spurs burned by Suns in penultimate preseason game

author: Mike Monroe
title: Spurs burned by Suns in penultimate preseason game
text:

Photo: Kin Man Hui, San Antonio Express-News Image 14 of 14 Spurs burned by Suns in penultimate preseason game 1 / 14 Back to Gallery From 19-year veteran Tim Duncan to the four rookies on the training camp roster, the goal for each Spurs player in Tuesday's preseason game against the Phoenix Suns was the same: Don't show up on Wednesday morning's videotape review for failing to get back on defense.
The outcome -- the Spurs lost for the fourth game in five preseason tries, falling to the Phoenix Suns, 104-84 at AT&T Center -- was relatively meaningless.
How they played meant plenty to Gregg Popovich and nothing mattered more to the Spurs coach as seeing how his team played transition defense.
"That's going to be the main goal today," veteran guard Manu Ginobili said before tipoff. "See if we can really do it. Pop is pounding on that, giving a lot of importance to that.”
Video: Spurs-Suns postgame wrap The Suns scored 19 fast break points on Tuesday, and though nine of those came off turnovers Popovich could not have been content.
"Hopefully, we improve soon,” Ginobili said. “It has definitely not been good, sometimes on the excuse that we are still getting there. But that's the easiest thing to do and we've always been pretty good in that.
But the Spurs had not been good in transition through the first four preseason games. Popovich labeled it as bad as the porous transition defense last season's Spurs played in losses in Games 6 and 7 of the team's first-round playoff loss to the Clippers in May.
How bad was that?
"Worst transition defense in the history of basketball," Popovich said.
Go to Express-News.com to read more about this game and to find more Spurs coverage.
